meanings.definition: A person who stirs up litigation.
meanings.sent1: The barretors in the courtroom were always causing trouble.
meanings.sent2: The judge warned the barretors to stop instigating legal disputes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous barretors thought it was fun to start arguments in court.
meanings.sent4: Their words were like barretors, constantly provoking conflict.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the barretors, for they thrive on legal chaos.

meanings.sent4: His actions spoke louder than words, a true barretors of the sea.
